alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 31 at 5:22PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...POTENTIAL FOR FREEZING RAIN WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY... Below-freezing overnight temperatures in combination with warm air moving in overhead may lead to light, intermittent freezing rain through the Kuskokwim Delta beginning Wednesday night. Temperatures warm during the day on Thursday, leading to a pause in the threat of freezing rain. Low temperatures are likely to be colder for Thursday night, leading to another chance for freezing rain, with more widespread coverage. A colder airmass moves in on Friday, transitioning precipitation to snow. Overall, there is a moderate chance (around 50%) for locations in the Kuskokwim Delta to observe freezing rain between Wednesday night and Friday. However, precipitation amounts are expected to be light, with areal coverage scattered and intermittent. As a result, ice accumulations are most likely to be trace to a few hundredths of an inch.
